A B C D F G H I J L M N O P R S T U V W X Y 

A

actionAsked - Variable in class gameplay.ai.phrasing.Phrasing
Field containing the asked action in a human readable format
AI - Class in gameplay.ai
Class representing the sadistic robot The robot ask the player to do terrible things without taking out the player's choice to do or not to do the task The AI has a mood system with 4 basic moods : Curiosity, Anger, Depression, Power complex The robot can switch between these moods considering the user's choices and interact with the environment in a bad way
AI(World) - Constructor for class gameplay.ai.AI
AI class main constructor
ALPINE_TUNDRA - Static variable in interface world.scenery.AlpineTundraTheme
String used to tell in which file is the sprite matching the Alpine Tundra style
AlpineTundraTheme - Interface in world.scenery
Interface used to define that a Scenery object have an Alpine Tundra style
Anger - Class in gameplay.ai.mood
 
Anger() - Constructor for class gameplay.ai.mood.Anger
 
angerBetrayalPhrases - Variable in class gameplay.ai.phrasing.Phrasing
Attribute containing the AI phrases for the anger Feeling that are said when the player refused to do the asked action
angerMotivationPhrases - Variable in class gameplay.ai.phrasing.Phrasing
Attribute containing the AI phrases for the anger Feeling that aims to motivate the player to do some actions
angerSlaveryPhrases - Variable in class gameplay.ai.phrasing.Phrasing
Attribute containing the AI phrases for the anger Feeling that are said when the player did the asked action
artificialIntelligence - Variable in class gameplay.GamePlay
Malicious artificial intelligence driving the player mad

Number of betrayals done by the player
betrayalThreshold - Variable in class gameplay.ai.mood.Mood
If the betrayal count goes above the betrayal threshold, then the robot must change its current mood (randomness required)

Image of the graphical representation of the button

Character - Class in world.character
Class used to handle a character (player or non-player) A character can be a purely decorative character or a talking character or a player character (the hero)

checkVerboseLevel() - Method in class debug.CliOptions
Check the verbose level considering the options with one dash
CliOptions - Class in debug
Class used to analyze the commands passed to the program For now, the verbose "-v" can be passed to the program (once or several times) and the help (containing the list of options available) can be queried via --help or -h You can set a level of verbose mode from 0 to 5, you just have to put -v for verbose mode level 1, -vv for level 2 and so on
CliOptions(String[]) - Constructor for class debug.CliOptions
Constructor of the CliOption
closeButton - Variable in class window.topbar.TopBar
Button closing the program when activated
critical(String, String, String) - Method in class debug.Verbose
Display and log a message with additionnal informations in the log file The message is displayed and logged if and only if the verbose level is greater or equal to 1

G

gameplay - package gameplay
 
GamePlay - Class in gameplay
Class handling the game play of this game It handle the creation of worlds, the movements of the main character and all the other characters, (including the constraints), the interactions between the main character and the other characters or the scenery The GamePlay class also controls the user interface mode (loading screen, win, fail, etc…) This class is the equivalent of the controller in the MVC paradigm.
GamePlay(CliOptions) - Constructor for class gameplay.GamePlay
Constructor of the GamePlay class
gamePlay - Static variable in class main.Philophobia
Game handler

main - package main

Main function of the A3P program You can set options like verbose mode to the program
map - Variable in class world.World
Two-dimensional array containing all objects within the world This object is filled using a file in the root directory and in the form of map[x][y] from top-left to right-bottom

Abstract class representing an AI mood

Mood for which there is a probability to be chosen
moodsBetrayalCount - Variable in class gameplay.ai.mood.Mood
Number of betrayals (requests from the AI not done by the user) done by the user when the AI was currently in this mood state
moodsSlaveryCount - Variable in class gameplay.ai.mood.Mood
Number of requests from the AI done positively by the user when the AI was in this mood state

nextMoods - Variable in class gameplay.ai.mood.Mood

OrderedPhrases - Class in gameplay.ai.phrasing
Class used to contain an ordered list of phrases It is ordered according to the last phrases that were spoken by the AI The last phrases that were spoken by the AI are pushed at the bottom of the list

Verbose - Class in debug
Class used to display and log messages all over this program
Verbose(int) - Constructor for class debug.Verbose
Class constructor
verbose - Static variable in class main.Philophobia
Global variable used for debugging
verboseLevel - Variable in class debug.CliOptions
Level of verbosing detected due to the args passed to the program
verboseMode - Variable in class debug.Verbose
Level of verbosing, from 0 to 5 The number of information displayed and logged goes increasingly as the number increase - Level 1 : Only critical errors and exeptions are displayed on the console - Level 2 : Serious but not critical errors and level 1 displayed - Level 3 : Warning and level 2 displayed - Level 4 : Informations and level 3 displayed - Level 5 : Everything, included Class instanciations and function calls and level 4 displayed
visible - Variable in class world.scenery.Scenery
Boolean equals to true if the scenery is visible, false if the scenery is not

world - package world
 
World - Class in world
World is a class used to handle the game world graphics The World class use the Scenery objects (or the objects implementing the Scenery class) to display images of several objects corresponding to trees and traps and so on
